channel.title: [PI] [317] Map Problem
channel.description:
Hey,
I cannot remember if I posted a topic here or somewhere else, but forgive me If I have already posted it, I loose track.
So,
[ul][li]Kalphite Queen's lair is completely black[/li] [li]Castle Wars is black, you can only see the NPC's inside. [/li] [list] [li]Objects such as doors, windows and other details are completely detached from the houses or objects and it looks really stupid[/li]
[/list]
I was told I need to edit the map in an Map Editor,
Others said, I would need to just download a new cache
I just don't know what else I am meant to do. I'm not asking for someone to supply me with any codes, files or anything, I need to learn - It is just really annoying and cannot move on until I fix that.[/ul]

item.title: [PI] [317] Map Problem
item.dc:creator: @ProjectDarkSouls ProjectDarkSouls
item.description:
@ProjectDarkSouls wrote:

I would appreciate it if somebody could offer assistance on this,

I have a perfect example of what I mean with the problems I am having - Just used a different client, ran it, and everything was fixed, Kalphite queen’s lair was perfect, castle wars perfect, An alter I didn’t see on the other client which is actually a ‘cart’ all the objects are in place. Only problem is setting it up to configure it to my source.

I make it worth your time,

Thanks friends.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] [317] Map Problem
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ProjectDarkSouls, post:11, topic:549787”]Appreciate it!

I’m just having a problems with adding the maps.[/quote]
When you add them, don’t forget to change the readvalues… Newer revisions have different data (sometimes) packed into the cache. Like when they added the ‘lend’ option to items, it changed the readvalues for items.

The readvalues you are specifically looking for can be found in the OnDemandFetcher.java. You’ll want to look at the start() method and the readData() (Usually named readValues or close to it) method.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] [317] Map Problem
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ProjectDarkSouls, post:7, topic:549787”]I’ll have a go at doing that.

When you mean, backwards, you mean, start at the end and work my way up?[/quote]
That tutorial is to pack data into the cache. You’re doing the opposite. You’re taking it out of the cache.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] [317] Map Problem
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ProjectDarkSouls, post:5, topic:549787”]When I mean ‘Borrow’ I try to stir away from using the word ‘Leech’.

I have found the client I want, downloaded, and now…? Do I just, take the files?[/quote]
You need to dump the data from the client…
Basically doing this, but backwards:
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/rs2-client/snippets/323269-index-repacking.html

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] [317] Map Problem
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Or you could just do a google search and download the data without “borrowing” it.

But yes, that would work too. You would just have to dump all the data from their client.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] [317] Map Problem
item.dc:creator: @ProjectDarkSouls ProjectDarkSouls
item.description:
@ProjectDarkSouls wrote:

Are you my Guardian angel?

If this fixes it, I will kiss you.

So my best bet is to ‘borrow’ a client and to ‘borrow’ their objects ect?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] [317] Map Problem
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

First, this is client sided. Why? because a PI server doesn’t have JAGGRAB, and the cache is read by the client.

Second, you don’t necessarily need a “map editor”. You might just need new map data or object data, or maybe both.

Look for maps/objects for a revision above 400… It should have what you need.

Read full topic
